channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: U.S. Ambassador to NATO Matthew Whitaker discusses planned Trump-Putin meeting
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with U.S. Ambassador to NATO Matthew Whitaker about the planned meeting between President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin and prospects for Ukraine.

item.title: What's at stake in the planned Trump-Putin meeting on Friday
item.description: President Trump will meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday to discuss a possible ceasefire in Ukraine. NPR takes a look at what's at stake.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: President Trump to meet with Russia's Putin on Friday, Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu defends plan to take over Gaza City, Trump promises crackdown on crime and homelessness in Washington, D.C.

item.title: Some of Whitney Houston's personal items to be auctioned off Monday
item.description: Personal items owned by Whitney Houston are being auctioned off on Monday. NPR talks with Darren Julien, executive director of Julien's Auctions, which is known for selling famous people's stuff.

item.title: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu defends military escalation in Gaza
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu made his case on Sunday about why Israel is moving to take control of the rest of the Gaza Strip, pushing back against mounting criticism of the escalation.

item.title: Some former world leaders taking up efforts for peace in the Middle East
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks former president of Ireland, Mary Robinson, who now works with human rights group The Elders, about her upcoming visit to Egypt's border with Gaza.

item.title: Conservative writer Max Boot discusses the changing world order
item.description: Steve Inskeep speaks with author and conservative commentator Max Boot about the changing world order.

item.title: Israeli airstrike kills a prominent Al Jazeera journalist and colleagues
item.description: Al Jazeera's Anas al-Sharif and four of his colleagues were killed in an Israeli airstrike on Sunday night in Gaza City.

item.title: President Trump and Russia's Putin to meet Friday for Ukraine talks
item.description: President Trump will meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday to discuss a possible ceasefire in Ukraine. NPR reports on what we know and don't know about the upcoming meeting.

item.title: A look at the prospects for a ceasefire in Ukraine ahead of Trump-Putin meeting
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel talks with former U.S. Ambassador to Ukraine John Herbst about the prospects of a ceasefire ahead of President Trump's meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin.
